hero.subtitle: Builder, not just busy — stories from known faces
hero.title: Always Building
hero.description: Your eyes are on the next step before your feet have landed on the last. You thrive on momentum, but when do you get to stand still and simply be?

line.0: Is there always 'one more thing' to finish before you can rest?
line.1: Do you struggle to slow down, even when you want to?
line.2: Are your relationships often fitted around your projects?
line.3: Does your identity feel tied to what you're making or achieving?
line.4: Have you ever asked yourself: What if I stopped building?

0.name: Elon Musk
0.quote: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

1.name: Oprah Winfrey
1.quote: Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.

2.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
2.quote: Little by little, one travels far.

3.name: Jane Goodall
3.quote: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.

4.name: Howard Schultz
4.quote: Dream more than others think practical. Expect more than others think possible.

0.title: The Drive to Build
0.body: Where others see an empty lot, you see a foundation. Where others see 'enough,' you see 'more to do.' Your ability to envision and create is your gift — but also your weight.

bullet.0: You always have multiple projects in motion.
bullet.1: You feel restless without a goal or plan.

0.nudge: Write down your current projects and mark the ones that truly align with your values — not just your habits.
0.cta: Align your builds with your values →

1.title: When the Structure Owns You
1.line: Not every build is worth the weight.
1.body: Sometimes the thing you're creating starts shaping you — dictating your time, choices, and even your health.

bullet.0: Your projects consume your personal time.
bullet.2: You stay with an idea long after its value has faded.

1.nudge: Ask: 'If I walked away today, what would I gain back in time, health, or joy?'

2.title: Balancing Bricks and Breath
2.line: Every strong structure rests on a solid foundation — and that includes you.
2.body: The stronger you are, the stronger your creations can be. Building with balance means making space for rest, reflection, and relationships.

bullet.0: You neglect personal needs for deadlines.
bullet.1: You haven't taken an intentional break in years.
bullet.2: You feel your passion turning into pressure.

2.nudge: Block out non-negotiable time each week for something unrelated to your projects.

2.p: Nurturing both you and your work

3.title: Building Beyond Yourself
3.line: The most meaningful builds last after you step away.
3.body: A true builder knows when to pass the tools. Teaching, delegating, and sharing the process can make your work bigger than you.

bullet.0: You want your work to have a legacy.
bullet.2: You want your builds to serve beyond you.

3.nudge: Choose one person to mentor or involve in your current project.

bridge.title: Ready to Shape the Future?
bridge.description: Drishiq helps builders find balance between creation and self-care, ensuring your energy, health, and clarity grow alongside your work.

connector.topband.label: Connector, not just networker — stories from known faces
connector.hero.title: Holding Voices Together
connector.hero.subtitle: You link people, spark opportunities, and turn strangers into allies. But in making sure everyone is connected, do you still feel seen yourself?
connector.stir.line.0: Do you often know everyone's story but rarely share your own?
connector.stir.line.1: Are you the first person people call for 'who to talk to'?
connector.stir.line.2: Do you feel responsible for holding communities together?
connector.stir.line.3: Have you felt lonely in the middle of your own network?
connector.stir.line.4: What would it be like to connect inward before outward?
connector.emote.0.title: Warm
connector.emote.0.subtitle: At home in any crowd
connector.emote.1.title: Overextended
connector.emote.1.subtitle: Too many threads to hold
connector.emote.2.title: Valued
connector.emote.2.subtitle: Others rely on you
connector.emote.3.title: Invisible
connector.emote.3.subtitle: Your story takes a backseat
connector.emote.4.title: Proud
connector.emote.4.subtitle: Building bridges others needed
connector.emote.5.title: Drained
connector.emote.5.subtitle: Energy spread too thin

celeb.items.name: Maya Angelou
celeb.items.quote: "We are more alike, my friends, than we are unalike."

celeb.items.name: Howard Schultz
celeb.items.quote: "In life, you can't have everything. But you can have the things that really matter."

celeb.items.name: Malala Yousafzai
celeb.items.quote: "When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful."

celeb.items.name: Desmond Tutu
celeb.items.quote: "Do your little bit of good where you are; those little bits overwhelm the world."

celeb.items.name: Fred Rogers
celeb.items.quote: "Mutual caring relationships require kindness, patience, and understanding."

connector.section.0.title: The Gift of Bridges
connector.section.0.line: You see where people should meet before they do.
connector.section.0.body: You're the thread between stories, the link between isolated ideas, the spark that makes things possible. The world needs your openness — and your ability to bring worlds together.
connector.section.0.bullet.0: You instinctively introduce people who might help each other.
connector.section.0.bullet.1: You can't stand to see someone left out.
connector.section.0.bullet.2: You're energized by watching relationships form.
connector.section.0.nudge: List three connections you've recently made that truly felt meaningful — not just convenient.
connector.section.1.title: Holding Too Many Threads
connector.section.1.line: Even the strongest net can fray under strain.
connector.section.1.body: When you're the glue in everyone's lives, it can feel like nothing moves without you — and that can quietly exhaust you.
connector.section.1.bullet.0: You feel guilty if you can't attend every event.
connector.section.1.bullet.1: Your inbox or messages are always full of requests.
connector.section.1.bullet.2: You find it hard to say 'no' without explanation.
connector.section.1.nudge: Pause before responding to a request. Ask: 'Is this mine to hold?'
connector.section.1.cta: Protect your space without breaking connections →
connector.section.2.title: Finding Your Own Place in the Network
connector.section.2.line: Connection is strongest when you're part of it too.
connector.section.2.body: It's easy to become the quiet center that no one notices — because you're busy making sure others are noticed. But your voice and needs deserve equal space.
connector.section.2.bullet.0: People know you as 'the connector' but not deeply as a person.
connector.section.2.bullet.1: Your own milestones often go uncelebrated.
connector.section.2.bullet.2: You're hesitant to ask for help.
connector.section.2.nudge: Share one personal goal or challenge with someone you trust this week.
connector.section.2.cta: Step into the circle you've created →
connector.section.3.title: Connecting for Change
connector.section.3.line: The most powerful bridges don't just link people — they change lives.
connector.section.3.body: When your connections are built with intention and care, they ripple outward, shaping communities and creating impact that lasts beyond you.
connector.section.3.bullet.0: You want your network to have purpose beyond social links.
connector.section.3.bullet.1: You dream of starting initiatives that help more people.
connector.section.3.bullet.2: You see potential in people others overlook.
connector.section.3.nudge: Choose one relationship or group to invest deeper time in — not more breadth, but more depth.
connector.bridge.title: You can connect without disappearing in the crowd.
connector.bridge.body: Drishiq helps connectors honor their own presence while continuing to weave the bonds that strengthen others.
connector.how.0.d: See where your energy is going.
connector.how.1.d: Learn to say yes without overextending.
connector.how.3.d: Align connections with what matters most to you.

dependent.topband.label: Dependent, not diminished — stories from known faces
dependent.hero.title: Dependent, By Design
dependent.hero.subtitle: Interdependence isn't a flaw. It's how humans move — together. The art is knowing which ties lift you, and which ones quietly tie you down.
dependent.stir.line.0: Who steadies you—and who steers you?
dependent.stir.line.1: Are your yes's chosen or automatic?
dependent.stir.line.3: What boundary would make you kinder?
dependent.emote.0.title: Support
dependent.emote.0.subtitle: Hands that steady
dependent.emote.1.title: Trust
dependent.emote.1.subtitle: Built in small acts
dependent.emote.2.title: Space
dependent.emote.2.subtitle: Love with air
dependent.emote.3.title: Boundaries
dependent.emote.3.subtitle: Kind and clear
dependent.emote.4.title: Gratitude
dependent.emote.4.subtitle: Thanks, not debt
dependent.emote.5.title: Growth
dependent.emote.5.subtitle: Updraft together

celeb.items.name: Maya Angelou
celeb.items.quote: "Nobody, but nobody, can make it out here alone."

celeb.items.name: Steve Jobs
celeb.items.quote: "Great things in business are never done by one person."

celeb.items.name: Priyanka Chopra Jonas
celeb.items.quote: "Leaning on others doesn't make you less — it makes you human."

celeb.items.name: Stephen Hawking
celeb.items.quote: "We are all now connected, like neurons in a giant brain."

celeb.items.name: Sachin Tendulkar
celeb.items.quote: "I owe my success to the people who stood by me."

dependent.section.0.title: The Comfort of Connection
dependent.section.0.line: Warmth that steadies. Routines that root.
dependent.section.0.body: Shared routines, inside jokes, someone to check in at the end of the day — these bonds keep you grounded. But comfort can also become a shield that keeps you from growing.
dependent.section.0.bullet.0: You lean on a small circle for most decisions.
dependent.section.0.bullet.1: You feel anchored — and sometimes hesitant to step out.
dependent.section.0.bullet.2: You say yes by default to keep peace.
dependent.section.0.nudge: List two supports that energize you and one that quietly drains you. Keep the first two close; redesign the third.
dependent.section.1.title: Boundaries Within Bonds
dependent.section.1.line: Closeness with air. Love with space.
dependent.section.1.body: Every healthy dependency has invisible lines. Too much reliance can blur them, too much distance can break them. Redrawing lines with clarity keeps trust from turning into tension.
dependent.section.1.bullet.0: You apologize for taking time alone.
dependent.section.1.bullet.1: You share passwords, calendars, plans by habit.
dependent.section.1.bullet.2: Saying 'no' feels like a threat to the relationship.
dependent.section.1.nudge: Write one boundary as a kind promise: 'I'll reply after 7pm tomorrow. I want to give this my best mind.'
dependent.section.2.title: The Weight of Expectations
dependent.section.2.body: Sometimes support comes with strings — obligations you didn't sign up for. It's not selfish to ask where the giving ends and the living begins.
dependent.section.2.bullet.0: You keep receipts of favors (theirs or yours).
dependent.section.2.bullet.1: You say 'sorry' for needs that are human.
dependent.section.2.bullet.2: You worry love will be withdrawn if you set limits.
dependent.section.2.nudge: Write a thank-you that doesn't promise payback: 'Thank you for being there. It meant a lot.' Period.
dependent.section.3.title: Mutual Growth
dependent.section.3.body: Dependence can be a launchpad when it's built on respect and shared progress. When you grow, your connections grow too.
dependent.section.3.bullet.0: You celebrate skills, not just favors.
dependent.section.3.bullet.1: You ask 'What helps you grow?' as often as 'Can you help me?'.
dependent.section.3.bullet.2: You turn support into shared momentum.
dependent.section.3.nudge: Ask one person this week: 'What's one small way I can back your goal?' Then do it.
dependent.bridge.title: Dependence can be dignified.
dependent.bridge.body: Drishiq helps you identify supports that empower rather than entangle — so you can lean without losing yourself.
dependent.how.0.d: Gentle prompts that turn fog into words — then into choices.
dependent.how.1.d: Small, stackable actions. No pressure, just momentum.
dependent.how.2.d: Notice who and what truly fuels you. Nudge what matters.
dependent.how.3.d: Short, human-sounding follow-ups so progress feels supported, not policed.
